2008.comment: Merging them as one as I played them together. Great games that fills a niche for me which is garden raising, normally I hate that genre. Great designs, music, discovery and a nice fast pace to growth, unlike Animal Crossing

2008.title: Valkyria Chronicles
2008.comment: Played for the art style, stayed for really interesting combat system and strong characters. Not too anime compared to the future titles. VEGETABLES!

2008.title: Burnout Paradise
2008.comment: Free DLC, incredible drop in/out multiplayer, good community, plenty of shortcuts to find. It set the standard for open world racing while still being fast, about taking down your opponent. But with all raches only having 8 finishing spots, you drove through the same areas a lot

2008.title: LittleBigPlanet
2008.comment: Dad kindly went back into Tesco to see if they had it and they did. Think cos my friend was with me it guilt tripped him. Very fond memories of Will Smith, H4H, instant death, slapping friends and my first ever platinum

2008.title: Dead Space
2008.comment: I played this near Halloween to fit the mood. The game has fantastic UI and sound design and great weapons. Enemy designs were a bit boring though

2008.title: Fable 2
2008.comment: One of the most memorable co-op experiences I have ever had. I married the town crier and my friend joined my world, killed him, and left. It was small in terms of world size but I loved the interactivity and freedom

2008.title: Kirby Super Star Ultra
2008.comment: A good (remake) of the SNES collection. A mix-match of modes for Kirby, some fleshed out like treasure hunt, others just feel like unecessary mini-game padding. As a whole it's considered one of the best, but I find it too basic and has quite a bad art style compared to the NES games

2008.title: Motorstorm Pacific Rift
2008.comment: Holy crap, 2 good racing games in 1 year. The music sucks ass but it had that custom music option so I got to put Yellowcard - Breathing over most of it like a chad. The nitrous sytem based on temp in the environment was rad and the track course was really sick with plenty of ramps

2008.title: Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm
2008.comment: At this point I was still into Naruto and this is the only good 3D anime brawler I have seen. It's all downhill from here. Really good art style and animations

2008.title: Metal Gear Solid 4
2008.comment: Having not played MGS 1-3, playing 4 was not as jarring as I expected. I traded GTA IV in for this so it cost £10. I ignored the 90 minute cutscene and story as a whole but I enjoyed the photography element, gun variety and aesthetics

2008.title: Devil May Cry 4
2008.comment: A good game in some ways and bad in others, especially when backtracking as Dante, you fight each boss 3 times in one playthrough but some fights are incredible and the demo is one of my earliest Xbox 360 memories

2008.title: Call of Duty: World at War
2008.comment: People wrote this off because it was Treyarch not IW. For me, I never liked WW1-2 games as it always looks drop and the guns are boring. Friend got me a beta invite when I was asleep so that was nice

2008.title: Fallout 3
2008.comment: At launch I loved this, overtime I've come to like it less primarily because it barely works on modern OS and NV overshadows it. The world seems lacking as most of it is spent in underground subways and it's very green

2008.title: God of War: Chains of Olympus
2008.comment: A decent downscaled God of War game that does suffer as expected for a PSP game. While it maintains the gore and fixed cameras, it lacks the scale. The story also felt too similar to past games of loss then a rise and repeat

2008.title: Army of Two
2008.comment: Played with a buddy and some of the co-op mechanics were pretty good but I wish it let you had more fun with it rather than only having gestures when boosting eachother. Could rip off car doors to make shields

2008.title: Gears of War 2
2008.comment: A game that epitomises the third person shooter design of that era, with constant turret sections, ugly colour palette, regen health and grenade spam. I can't remember liking anything about it

2007.title: Call of Duty 4
2007.comment: Absorbed my life for 3 years and I refused to move onto WAW or MW2 or Blops. I wish the multiplayer was a smoother experience as PS3 owners had 'DOWNLOADING GAME SETTINGS' constantly. Some iconic single player levels too without going edgy like the next CoDs

2007.title: The Witcher
2007.comment: A game I struggled to fall in love with, but when I did, I fell in love with the slavic folklore, the music,the autumn colour palette and the mini-games. I remember my dad buying me this in Tesco cos of the cool cover

2007.title: Bioshock
2007.comment: A unique setting, great enemy designs, incredible use of lighting and physics with your magic powers. The game popularised audio logs which I now hate and some parts such as the final boss are real dumb but I thought this game in 2007 was incredible

2007.title: Professor Layton and the Curious Village
2007.comment: Wonderful art style and excellent use of the DS screens. Was a really big franchise then kinda died off. This one is great for a first entry, with good puzzles and even post-game content. Uni professor puzzle books also contributed which I love

2007.title: Professor Layton and Pandora's Box
2007.comment: An amazingly quick follow up to Curious Village, and while similar, the secret ended up being something heartwarming. Series has been somewhat tainted by a flash animation my friend kept quoting

2007.title: Stalker Shadow of Chernobyl
2007.comment: Incredibly immersive game that I was 30 minutes away from finishing back in 2010 before messing up a quick save cos I was new to hardcore PC games. Ridiculously accurate AI but X16 lab is a haunting experience

2007.title: God of War II
2007.comment: Something in 2 didn't click like the first. I think it was all too similar or I just fell off Kratos as a character because he was just an angry boy. The scale of Gaia was absolutely incredible though

2007.title: Team Fortress 2
2007.comment: Bought physically as I didn't know about Steam and I couldn't get into it until at some point it clicked. I think it's gotten worse as time went on but the original purity was something special. The best character models

2007.title: Super Mario Galaxy
2007.comment: I got my Wii quite late and I was never the biggest Mario fan, so by the time I played this, I heard incredible things. And yet many levels were boring and short and made little use of the planet gravity physics

2007.title: Uncharted
2007.comment: Originally didn't care much for it but now it's probably my favourite Uncharted. Nice singular location with variety in it's level design.

2007.title: Hotel Dusk: Room 215
2007.comment: Played at the reverence of my friend who says this is one of his favourites. It has a wonderful rotoscope art style, music and a very hotel cabin beige look to the environments. Good mystery with solid music but some of the touch screen elements didn't work and felt unecessary like the bowling.

2007.title: Ratchet & Clank Tools of Destruction
2007.comment: My first Ratchet game, gotten with my PS3. I fell quite in love with it but compared to the newer titles, it does lack that little extra, I remember the final boss being cool

2007.title: Crackdown
2007.comment: I remember playing this and thinking the open world was rad, and it still is. Collecting orbs influenced other games like inFamous and the gang territory system was interesting

2007.title: Halo 3
2007.comment: Played with my Xbox obsessed friend and the hardest difficulty and that still irks me. I dont know what is so appealing about Halo to people but good for them I guess, it didn't do anything for me

2007.title: Portal
2007.comment: A really short game that felt more of an experiment. So short I don't think the puzzles got more complex which is one of the requirements I have for puzzle game. Found Glados more annoying than funny which no one agrees with

2007.title: Burnout Dominator
2007.comment: Even as a pre-teen I noticed something was off. Little did I know it was a PSP game that I was playing on a PS2. It had multiple language versions of Hey You by Avril Lavigne which was very odd

2007.title: Assassin's Creed
2007.comment: What Ass Creed was, is nothing like today. Back then it prioritised deathly blows, stealth and had ambition. Now it's tiered loot, no stealth or care in your assassinations. I don't like AC and yet refuse to play new AC. It's lost its soul

2007.title: Timeshift
2007.comment: A neat idea but rather poor execution. The rain when you pause time looks great and the time mechanic does make for really good moments, but can't use them in a creative enough way to make the powers varied

2007.title: Victorious Boxers: Revolution
2007.comment: AKA: The Wii Hajime no Ippo game. It's somewhat alright since it uses the same input motion as Wii Sports boxing. A good roster for the game but I remember them not feeling all too different

2007.title: Mass Effect
2007.comment: I tried to give ME a fair shot but the entire dialogue system being based on good/bad always felt too video gamey to where I could not take these characters seriously. Just look at Planescape from 1999 for quality none-judging but consequential dialogue choices

2006.title: Elite Beat Agents
2006.comment: One of the absolute best DS games. A punk soundtrack with some classics on there too. Great humour and I always appreciate a game where failing is still exciting. Hate the DS stylus and the wheel spin sections though

2006.title: Okami
2006.comment: One of my absolute favourite games from one of my favourite game directors. A beautiful stylized Japanese game which started my love for Yokai. A unique combat system with a great story, funny side characters and a deeply interactive world

2006.title: Viva Pinata
2006.comment: Don't know what made me buy this but glad I did. Incredible soulful game with such odd requirements to unlock new pinatas

2006.title: Bully
2006.comment: I really wish Rockstar would make smaller scale games like this as it was enjoyable to do the mini-game classes, especially English which was basically Countdown

2006.title: God Hand
2006.comment: A game that's too bloody hard but also incredible. Good humour, unique combat system and makes me wish Mikami would move away from horror games

2006.title: Persona 3 FES
2006.comment: BABY BABY BABY BABY BABYYYY! A good game but the lack of party control can be a hindrance. One social link really stands out to me about a guy dealing with cancer while writing a childrens book about a pink elephant. Not a happy ending sadly

2006.title: Black
2006.comment: Played much later but even here, Criterion makes an FPS on the PS2 with a punch. Some excellent sound design for a ps2 shooter but other than that, it was pretty ordinary

2006.title: Pokemon Diamond
2006.comment: A game I used to love and now kinda hate. The pokemon variety in Gen IV is abysmal with only one other fire type. Very slow with mad HM usage and not very memorable routes. The safari zone sucks too

2006.title: Dead Rising
2006.comment: Finished on the night of Eurovision. Starts off frustrating but once you get into the groove of understanding the UI and map, it gets better. Fun easter eggs but not a lot of useful items

2006.title: Thrillville
2006.comment: A great title for a roller coaster game BUT, this has too much of a focus on interacting with visitors on the ground level. It had some charm for sure such as the ability to flirt with guests with pick up lines such as: 'You're all curves with no breaks'

2006.title: Need for Speed Carbon
2006.comment: The only NFS game I have finished and I think I enjoyed the night time vibes a lot. It is no Burnout but then again nothing is. The maps designed for drifting were cool too

2005.title: Devil May Cry 3
2005.comment: Hideaki Itsuno knocks it out of the park after a disappointing DMC2. Incredible combat for a PS2 game made better with the Style Switcher mod. Ruthlessly hard at times but what is the price to pay for power

2005.title: Ouendan
2005.comment: JP only but EBA is the west 'equivalent'. Some great songs like LINDA LINDA. An obese egyptian lady loses weight and then the man falls in love her won't pass today. If you failed at the Ramen song, a cat would come in and piss on the floor

2005.title: Resident Evil 4
2005.comment: A friend lent me a copy back on the PS2 but I couldn't get into it. Now I played it on PC and had a blast. The starting village area is absolutely incredible and even referenced recently by God of War 2018 devs

2005.title: Rogue Galaxy
2005.comment: CheckedIGN and saw trailers for this. With my friend at my house, asked my dad to take me to Blockbuster to get it, leaving my friend in my room alone for some reason... I remember listening to Take That - Stardust during the 100 floor dungeon. Insect and factory mini-games were so fun

2005.title: God of War
2005.comment: I played the demo that was included in a Playstation magazine and that opening boss with the Hydra showed off such tremendous scale, so I had to play it. And boy it delivered. Really brutal animations for my 12 year old innocent eyes

2005.title: Psychonauts
2005.comment: Buddy lost a bet so he had to play this mellow game but I freely joined in too. Then he proceeded to bugger off from online world so we didn't speak about it! Milkman is a iconic level but I preferred the board game world, that was really cool. A unique look at mental health but the resolutions were poor

2005.title: Ultimate Spider-Man
2005.comment: This game had a great art style and one of the first open world games I remember simply enjoying moving around in. Venom was also playable which is cool

2005.title: The Warriors
2005.comment: Rockstar making a movie licensed game is not something that will happen anymore and that sucks, I enjoy their smaller scale game. Finished on a co-op Saturday with my bud and a good beat em up even without seeing the movie

2005.title: Age of Empires III
2005.comment: The game on my PC at the time, did not run it well at all, and I think that affected my enjoyment of it. It also had a heavy multiplayer focus which scared me back then!

2005.title: Dynasty Warriors 5
2005.comment: I loved the intro so much, and I thought with it now being 2005, the graphics would represent the opening cinematic. It did not. Still fun-ish but nothing to 3

2005.title: Burnout Revenge
2005.comment: Some consider this the best but to me, the car trafficking aspect ruined threats of crashing into cars and the music was a downgrade. This came to Xbox BC but 3 did not. :(

2005.title: FATE
2005.comment: A classic ARPG that is Torchlight-light. Oddly charming but very simple. Framerate plummets despite being a 15 year old game BUT I got to summon beetle to fight for me, so that was rad

2005.title: Midnight Club 3
2005.comment: I dont remember anything other than driving and exclusively listening to Pain by Jimmy Eat World as it was the only good song on the soundtrack. Not surprised its now dead

2004.title: Paper Mario The Thousand-Year Door
2004.comment: Alas, this twilt world is too full of pain and contradiction, too full of broken dreams. A genuinely funny game but the levels do make for some slight backtracking. An excellent support cast. 'Guess again nerd!'

2004.title: Burnout 3
2004.comment: The best racing game, of all time. Not a dumb ugly sim, no slot machines. Just pure adrenaline fueled racing where traffic is a threat. Wish it emulated well or was on Xbox BC cos some levels are an eyesore

2004.title: Ratchet & Clank Up Your Arsenal
2004.comment: Felt very similar to going commando which is fair since it has only been a year. Nefarious is a good villain but doesn't need to be a staple going forward. The most digusting yellow UI

2004.title: World of Warcraft
2004.comment: Got my hunter to level 60 after TBC came out and then left after logging in and seeing my guild just vanished. Some fond memories but it needs to be put to rest

2004.title: Katamari Damacy
2004.comment: Controls are somewhat horrid. Anyway, some of the best music in video game history, best credit sequence, fun gameplay if not sometimes confusing regarding the collisions. Also had a level where you gotta collect all the crabs and one that ended in 3 seconds after getting a bear

2004.title: Van Helsing
2004.comment: Weird tastes back then. But! This is a Van Helsing Devil May Cry game. And that's rad! Big head cheat mode I remember. Who knew back in 2004 I would get this wonderful came called Bloodborne

2004.title: Kohan 2
2004.comment: Kohan 2 was something I fell in love with which no one talks about to this day. I thought it was superior to AOE as it was faster paced and the special Kohan units is something we see today in MOBAs

2004.title: Halo 2
2004.comment: At the time when playing in co-op, it was my favourite Halo game and might still be when I play it solo... eventually. Duel-weilding guns was great and the level design I remembered being good

2004.title: Fable
2004.comment: I remember when I jokingly spelld out 'shit' instead of 'this' and the game mocked me for it. Truly a sign of a good game and hope the new Fable has the same cozy atmosphere

2004.title: Onimusha 3
2004.comment: A childhood favourite that to me doesn't hold up due it's high difficulty but the motorbike jumping onto a boat cutscene is still fantastic and I hope it makes a return at some point

2003.title: Ratchet & Clank Going Commando
2003.comment: This is probably where the Ratchet formula gets locked and the speed gets upped a lot. Weapon levels, skill points are new and continue to modern Ratchet. Some fun levels where you fight as Godzilla sized Clank

2003.title: Viewtiful Joe
2003.comment: Henshin a go-go baby! A game where I love the style more so than the gameplay. It was quite hard but the game made good use of the time manipulation such as slowing down the helicopters blades to lower it, and more!

2003.title: Dynasty Warriors 4
2003.comment: I remember feeling quite bummed out by 4. Its weapons started having RPG stats and the ability for all officers to weild whatever they wanted ruined their unique moveset

2003.title: Shin Megami Tensei Nocturne
2003.comment: Finally finished thanks to remaster. These dungeons are the worst, all of them have invisible teleport traps and that's as complex as it gets. Real neat character goals though and no real villain due to you picking your own alignments

2003.title: Devil May Cry 2
2003.comment: It's a miracle Itsuno kept his job after this but it wasn't his fault! Some levels were so ugly it was an eyesore, the Stinger move animation is so bad, guns are overpowered and there's a boss fight that is just a helicopter you shoot at

2002.title: Resident Evil Remake
2002.comment: I love that mansion even after a 20 year gap from the original. Some stuff is a bit punishing but not impossible and the many changes of the mansion throughout kept surprising

2002.title: Ratchet & Clank
2002.comment: Never could get into the very first one, but I pulled through for E3 and fell in love with the level design, character relationships and humour. Quite sassy characters but moving around felt off, aerial enemies didn't suit their in-game lock on but still great

2002.title: Serious Sam TSE
2002.comment: A sequel rushed out within a year, and I also somehow still enjoy it a lot. The Jingle Bells Christmas music is great but feels a bit too out of place. Not many new enemy designs but still good secrets

2002.title: Super Mario Sunshine
2002.comment: The only 3D Mario platformer I hadn't played and well, I don't like it. Collision detection can be naff and fall through moving objects but the summer vibe is really nice

2002.title: Kingdom Hearts
2002.comment: I think I hate the series more than the game. Halloween Town was very fun because of the character designs and exploring with Disney characters was neat. But everything on the Xenahort side sucks so much. I hate Nomura

2002.title: Pokemon Ruby
2002.comment: A miserable region to explore due to HMs and music that sounds like farts thanks to the GBA soundchip but the east side of the region is warm and tropical, and the new Pokemon are so good compared to the weak selection of Gen 2

2002.title: State of Emergency
2002.comment: In the UK, I think the markesting mislead us to think it was by the GTA guys. Not my kind of game but I thought it had a good amount of weapons. It's Dead Rising with chavs

2001.title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney
2001.comment: A really good visual novel with funny writing, great character designs and the best sound effects. It was great to figure out the inaccuracies to a persons statement, especially with the parrot. Not been able to get into the other games

2001.title: Halo
2001.comment: Played it solo and I was able to appreciate the game more but so many of the levels had repeated level design which in the end did more me a lot. And the flood can bugger off even if it is a fascinating story element

2001.title: Red Faction
2001.comment: I mostly remember making tunnels in the multiplayer map with my brother and seeing how far we could go before it stops us. Honestly quite an incredible tech accomplishment on the PS2

2001.title: Dynasty Warriors 3
2001.comment: One of the games of my youth. Put hundreds of hours into it. Guan Yu was the best

2001.title: Serious Sam TFE
2001.comment: The definitive Serious Sam game what with the Dunes level. Really amazing secrets such as the developer heads in the first level which is a stand out for me. Iconic enemy designs

2001.title: Devil May Cry
2001.comment: My first Kamiya game, who knew back then he would have such a presence as his career went on. Fun but very basic compared to the modern games that diverted from the serious tone. The underwater sections also suck

2001.title: Final Fantasy X
2001.comment: A crazy foundation for a setting in an RPG and a nice turn-based combat system that does away with the ATB. Awful dungeons too. But something kept me going back and I don't know why

2001.title: Luigi's Mansion
2001.comment: A short charming game but so much backtracking. The boo names were really funny such as GameBoo Advance but was very basic as a whole

2001.title: Ico
2001.comment: Does this deserve a 10 because Miyazaki would not have given us Demon's/Dark/Bloodborne? Probably. But for 2001, this game is probably special, I played it in 2015ish and hated it. Last game I got from Blockbuster. RIP

2000.title: Dark Cloud
2000.comment: A perfect game for the summer. Charming and full of soul. I remember losing my mind when I realised I was no longer building a town but a Sun God Mecha. I loved it so much I made a Dark Cloud x Pacific Rim video

2000.title: Final Fantasy IX
2000.comment: A wonderful charming tale with the best music. It's full of soul and feels like the most traditional Final Fantasy game that we haven't seen since

2000.title: Diablo 2
2000.comment: Finally crossed off a classic but some parts are a bit too outdated and found it quite ugly to play though. I can see why it popularised a genre and it's better than Diablo 3 but I hope a remake makes it more accessible

2000.title: Banjo Tooie
2000.comment: A childhood classic that upon playing again realise it absolutely sucks. So much backtracking and padded out time due to unecessary obsfucation. I remember my brother watching me beat the final boss when I was about 8

1999.title: Pokemon Gold
1999.comment: What a sequel! The second region didn't blow me away when I was a kid. Many staple features of Pokemon introduced. Day/Night, breeding, shinies. Just an absolute meaty piece of content

1999.title: Pokemon Stadium
1999.comment: One of the coolest things I remember about this game is using the expansion pack thing to play Pokemon GB games on my TV and hearing the sound coming from the TV and not the Gameboy. The mini-games shined in this game such as Lickitung with great sound effects

1999.title: Age of Empires II
1999.comment: Something never clicked like the first, but it was still something I liked. I think it felt too similar but the fact the re-releases are still getting content is quite incredible

1999.title: Pokemon Pinball
1999.comment: The cart used an AA battery to replicate vibration sounds. I feel sorry for the parents who had to buy so many batters for the GB era. Fun Pinball game but I was never good

1998.title: Banjo Kazooie
1998.comment: One of my childhood games that still holds up to this very day. A blast from start to finish and the quiz at the end shows how proud the developers are of their level and sound design, better than Super Mario 64 for sure

1998.title: Half-Life
1998.comment: It was great to play through the game that is Valves origins and it still holds up. The chatter of the other scientists was really funny but the final areas were quite boring

1998.title: Pokemon TCG
1998.comment: Played on a whim and kinda loved it. Despite the small GB screen, the interface works tremendously well for the TCG rules. The avatar sprites animate which is comical and card art is replicated well

1998.title: Xenogears
1998.comment: Played this on a PSClassic and it was a miserable experience due to constant crashes and the awful controller. None the less it has a great combat system for a PS1 RPG and some of the best Yasunori Mitsuda music

1998.title: The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time
1998.comment: You know, I think I just don't like old zelda that much. While the spooky elements of this game were incredible, I still found it a chore to play, primarily due to dungeons
1998.url: /img/The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time.jpg

1997.title: Castlevania Symphony of the Night
1997.comment: While the first half the game is too easy, it did a great job of making it more accessibile while stil maintaining the core of Castlevania and RPG mechanics and weapon drops made playing experience

1997.title: Final Fantasy VII
1997.comment: Such an oddball in terms of story for Final Fantasy but it has an incredible setting, beautiful places like Cosmo Canyon and feels like a long adventure. Cid is the best version of Cid but did feel slow

1997.title: Age of Empires
1997.comment: Probably the first PC game I ever played and that may have made me like this one over the more popular sequel. Really good sound design

1997.title: Goldeneye 007
1997.comment: Dated aiming controls but the sound effects, mission variety and multiplayer set a standard makes this game an exceptional title. Hacks have made this game playable with mouse and keyboard which really makes it hold up.

1997.title: Blast Corps
1997.comment: A seriously hard game I played as part of Rare Replay and egged on by a friend. It still had some elements of Rares charm and a good destruction engine for a N64 game but it is very basic

1996.title: Super Mario RPG
1996.comment: Asked my friend what SNES game to play, he said this, had a blast, never doubted him since. Geno for Smash

1996.title: Pokemon Red
1996.comment: I was born in a time where I cannot remember when Pokemon didn't exist. Some parts of this game are straight up broken but each Pokemon having its own cry on a gameboy cart blows me away. Wizardy how it works

1996.title: Super Mario 64
1996.comment: Mario handles the transition to 3D well unlike Sonic, Pokemon and a bunch of others. The movement tech is incredible for a first go but when I replayed the All-Stars version, I came down on the world design as many felt like slapped together pieces, and not a world lived in

1996.title: Mario Kart 64
1996.comment: Classic kart racer with good multiplayer with buds. However, Rainbow Road is overrated! It has to be said. Once again, good sound effects and Moo Moo Farm is a banger

1996.title: Donkey Kong Country 3
1996.comment: I hate Kiddy Kong, or whatever his dumb ugly name is. It's gone one step further away from Donkey Kong. I wonder if Nintendo hate Rare for making so many ugly Kongs

1995.title: Chrono Trigger
1995.comment: A super charming RPG that I've tried multiple times but finally finished for the first time. It's nice to have a prison breakout sequence not last 5 hours in a game

1995.title: Tetris Attack
1995.comment: I love Puzzle league and this is pretty much the first inception of it, something about the simple aesthetic compared to the cylindrical nature future games have keep it simple

1995.title: Yoshi's Island
1995.comment: Wonderful art style and music but the baby throwing and crying sound were quite annoying during the harder sections. Fun mini-games such as brick-break mixed with platformer level design was really cool. Good boss designs and levels that often felt massive

1995.title: Donkey Kong Country 2
1995.comment: I weirdly prefer the first game which is an upopular opinion, but if I can't play as Donkey Kong, it aint a true Donkey Kong game! A bit too many secrets but meaty in content

1994.title: Final Fantasy VI
1994.comment: Cyan is one of the best FF characters and while I did enjoy it as a whole, I still never wanted to experiment with many of the 13 playable characters due to not liking the ATB system

1994.title: Donkey Kong Country
1994.comment: Played alongside this with a bud and talked about our experience. Wasn't as difficult as I remember and Elevator Antics sticks out as a favourite level but the underwater levels aren't so great

1994.title: Demon's Crest
1994.comment: A good sidescroller I played on the SNES classic that thankfully isn't as punishing as the previous Ghosts n Goblins entries, I did not get the true ending as I missed some collectibles

1994.title: Super Metroid
1994.comment: Great sfx, visuals and designs yet I found the game annoying to play and navigate. Jumping never felt great even with the 4 different upgrades, map never showed all doors which made backtracking annoying. Cool set piece for the final boss. Some cool mechanics like the freeze gun to make platforms out of enemies

1993.title: Mega Man X
1993.comment: My first Mega Man game finished and probably the last, aside from Legends... eventually. A good game that's a bit too bloody hard. Really good sprite work and boss designs

1992.title: Super Mario Kart
1992.comment: A fun game with good sound effects and even the music. It looks very basic now, and it is, but it had the soul of Mario games and fleshed out Mario side characters

1991.title: Super Castlevania IV
1991.comment: A game that is more difficult than it is fun, but some levels were defnitely cool and stand out. I probably would not have finished it if I didn't look up and find the hidden items/powerups before the final boss

1991.title: The Legend of Zelda Link to the Past
1991.comment: After about 10 attempts I finally finished it. Awful overworld music but the dungeons often making use of the outside world was really cool. It's a shame this set out the blueprint for Zelda games until Breath of the Wild
1991.url: /img/The Legend of Zelda Link to the Past.jpg

1990.title: The Secret of Monkey Island
1990.comment: An actually funny game thanks to the witty comeback combat system as well as the ending. Good sprites, UI and puzzles for an old game. Really good dev commentary too

1987.title: Final Fantasy
1987.comment: I played the PSP port and that held up. It is extremely basic in the good way and played it on my Vita while watching Modern Family. Matoya's Cave music is one of my favourites still

1986.title: Dragon Quest
1986.comment: Played this alongside a buddy and it got very grind heavy and was kind of obtuse in design that almost felt like it required a Nintendo Power magazine but even back then DQ had charm
